Bag O' Links - 10/8/2009

10 Aug 2009

  • All Twitter Related APIs in one gem – mother of all twitter gems.
  • Scheduling with Ruby – Using the whenever gem to control your cron tasks.
  • Rails Logging tips – control your logger.
  • JQuery intoViewPort – scroll elements into your viewports.
  • How Faster is Ruby on Linux – Oz, it’s for you.
  • Lot’s of CSS grid systems, Generators and other crap – A bunch of CSS tools, sort your own out.
  • HTML5 for average people – hi! it’s me!.
  • OOC – Object Oriented CSS – interesting.
  • RailsBridge badges – Now you can publicly show your support for inclusiveness and friendliness in the Rails community.
  • re-introduction to Javascript – so you think you know Javascript?
  • Join a Sinatra and Rails applications – for what? i don’t know.. but might be useful.
  • Creating a Proxy Class in Ruby
  • Rails Optimistic Locking and MySQL – some issues to be aware of.

GitHub Treasures

  • distributed_logreader – a log reader that allows for parallel processing. It is highly configurable allowing you to choose different parallel distribution and archiving strategies.
  • how_long_ago – another time/distance formatter.
  • ModelFactory – another testing related factory to mock up objects.
  • GCmonitor – a ruby module to track GC.
  • QueryTrace – trace where was a query invoked, from the rails log.
